comment.text: Working great on AMD 3700X + NVIDIA.
Works fine on an OpenStack VM, physical Intel-based machine and an Aarch64 machine (PineBook Pro).
Works fine on Acer Aspire V3-571 v: V2.11 CPU: Quad Core Intel Core i7-3632QM GPU: Intel 3rd Gen Core processor Graphics Controller KDE Plasma. No regressions found

Looks ok for me. Runs since it was ready in koji. Works on baremetal (non UEFI mode) AMD Ryzen5 3600, Mainboard MSI B450M Mortar Max with prop. nvidia driver from rpmfusion.org (GTX980 card). Works with Gnome-Desktop (Xorg). Regression test passed (paxtest, selinux-dac-controls and libhugetlbfs skipped).
Default & performance regression tests PASS, libhugetlbfs & paxtest was skipped. Tested on x86_64, PRIME Z270-A, i5-7600K, 16GB DDR4, AMD RX 580 8GB (MESA 21.0.3-2) & 970 EVO M.2.

Up for a few hours now and no issues noticed..   
The enabled Default and Performance tests pass OK. AMD 965, x86_64 work station, SSD's > RAID1. Plasma DE from Zawertun's COPR, X-server, nVidia GTX 650 (GK107) nVidia RPM's from RPMFusion (465.27)

Work fine. 
Acer Aspire A315-53 V1.22; CPU: Intel i3-8130U (4) @ 3.400GHz; GPU: Intel UHD Graphics 620; Memory: 3800MiB
No regressions found.
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)

All tests passed Fedora 33 Mate on Acer NITRO 5 AN515-54-574Q 

Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-9300H CPU @ 2.40GHz (8) @ 4.100GHz

GPU: Intel UHD Graphics CoffeeLake-H GT2 [UHD Graphics 630] 

GPU: NVIDIA Model: TU117M GeForce GTX 1650 Mobile / Max-Q
Up and running without issues since installed for > 1 day on i7-9750H c/w GeForce GTX 1650 Mobile and qemu/KVM (x86_64 on x86_64).
wfm on baremetal.
Tested in KVM on a system with a Intel Core i5-3570. Kernel regression test passes.

All fine except Wifi (ath11k_pci) stopped working. 

On Dell XPS 15 9500. 

Intel Corporation 10th Gen Core Processor Host Bridge/DRAM Registers
Intel Corporation 6th-10th Gen Core Processor PCIe Controller
Intel Corporation CometLake-H GT2 [UHD Graphics]
Intel Corporation Comet Lake USB 3.1 xHCI Host Controller
NVIDIA Corporation TU117M [GeForce GTX 1650 Ti Mobile]
Qualcomm QCA6390 Wireless Network Adapter [AX500-DBS (2x2)]
works for me
aarch64 and x86_64
Wifi ath11k_pci does not work on Dell xps 9310.

bugs.title: CVE-2021-32606 kernel: isotp_setsockopt in net/can/isotp.c allows privilege escalation via use-after-free

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-32606 kernel: isotp_setsockopt in net/can/isotp.c allows privilege escalation via use-after-free

long_desc.thetext:
The isotp_setsockopt in net/can/isotp.c allows a use-after-free. This leads to arbitrary kernel execution by overwriting the sk_error_report()
pointer, which can be misused in order to execute a user-controlled ROP chain to gain root privileges.

External Reference:

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/05/11/16

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1959674]

bugs.title: CVE-2021-32606 kernel: isotp_setsockopt in net/can/isotp.c allows privilege escalation via use-after-free [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-32606 kernel: isotp_setsockopt in net/can/isotp.c allows privilege escalation via use-after-free [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-32606 kernel: isotp_setsockopt in net/can/isotp.c allows privilege escalation via use-after-free

long_desc.thetext:
The isotp_setsockopt in net/can/isotp.c allows a use-after-free. This leads to arbitrary kernel execution by overwriting the sk_error_report()
pointer, which can be misused in order to execute a user-controlled ROP chain to gain root privileges.

External Reference:

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/05/11/16

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1959674]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1959673,1959674

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

Am I correct in assuming that on a system that does not use CAN, the following would be a sufficient mitigation?
    grep -q can-isotp /etc/modules-load.d/blacklist.conf 2>/dev/null || echo "blacklist can-isotp" >> /etc/modules-load.d/blacklist.conf
